result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D. Debartelo

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Amended 
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Family of Kenneth R., Dean B. and Charles C.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Watson and Atty Corcoran.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE's motion for bond reduction to $10K CB.  State's position as stated on the record.  Court modifies bond to $15000 CB with same conditions - *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Family of Kenneth R., Dean B. and Charles C..   10/5 FPT removed from calendar at request of Atty Watson.   FPT 11/18 9am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Tab pulled for Branch 2; Judge Rossell.   

NOTE - Tab pulled in error; case should be assigned to Br 1
of Judge filed by Atty Watson

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Kristyne Watson in court with Defendant Jeremy D. Debartelo who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes: Atty Watson requests an adjournment for further negotations and states she is unavailble for trial on 8/22 and also informed Intake at the prelim.  Court will cancel the trial and Atty Watson requests another a new date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy D. Debartelo appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson and Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
